page.title: 04RELIGION IN TODDINGTON 1
page.content: The Church of England church, standing near the village green was consecrated in 1222 and is dedicated to{St.George {of England. }It owes its present form to the Peyvres, great church builders of the parish, who lived at Wadlowes near Toddington. The church, built of Totternhoe stone, has a ninety foot centrally placed tower which houses a peal of eight bells. {Interesting features}include a three storey parvise, a fifteenth century water stoop, medieval wall paintings, carved wooden decoration on the roof. The south and north transept chapels contain the tombs of the Peyvre,Cheyne and Wentworth families. Today the Rector is resident in the Leighton Rd. Rectory. Church services are taken twice daily every weekday, Holy Communion, Family Eucharist and Evensong conducted on Sundays.
